pr_title: Ignore DebugLogExporter if ZEEEB_DEBUG is false

timeline.author: pihme

timeline.bodyText: Is it deliberate that the literal is used here? (as opposed to using DebugLogExporter.defaultConfig();
timeline.author: pihme

replies.bodyText: I don't understand - do you mean the exporter ID? This is using DebugLogExporter.defaultConfig().
replies.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText: I mean the key in the map
replies.author: pihme

replies.bodyText: Ah, no I just refactored the usage - I can't really speak for the original intent, and I was unaware we had a DebugLogExporter.defaultExporterId(), but I can use it 👍
replies.author: npepinpe

timeline.bodyText: Is there a test case that verifies the debug exporter is not enabled if the environment variable doesn't exist?
timeline.author: pihme

replies.bodyText:
No, and honestly I was on the fence about the worth of this test - on one hand, the normal state is to not have the exporter. On the other hand, previous versions would include it regardless of the value, so I did want a "regression" test to ensure the behaviour was changed.
However, now that I think about it, we could simply have a test which checks there are no exporters by default (we have several other default tests, but none for exporters).
replies.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText: Added the test and a follow up issue: #5944
replies.author: npepinpe

timeline.author: pihme
pihme

timeline.message: chore(broker): ignore debug log exporter if false
